preloadTrial.messageText: Please wait while the experiment loads. This may take a few minutes.

fullScreenTrial.prompt:
The experiment will switch to full screen mode.
Click the button to continue.

trial1.header1: Welcome to the world of Lexicality!
trial1.paragraph1: You are a wizard searching for the gate that will return you to your home on Earth. To reach the gate, you must journey over lands ruled by magical guardians.
trial1.paragraph2: In order for the guardians to let you pass through the land, you will have to tell the difference between made-up words and real words.
trial1.header2: Welcome to the Single Word Recognition activity!
trial1.paragraph3: In this activity, you will look at words that show up on the screen.
trial1.paragraph4: You will then need to tell the difference between made-up words and real words.

trial2.header: A real or made-up word will flash very quickly at the center of the screen.
trial2.paragraph1: The made-up words might look like English words, but they do not mean anything in English. For example, laip, bove, or cigbert are made-up words. If you see a made-up word, press the LEFT ARROW.
trial2.paragraph2: The real words will be ones you recognize. They are real English words like is, and, basket, or lion. If you see a real word, press the RIGHT ARROW.

trial3.header: Let us review which arrow we press for made-up words and real words.
trial3.paragraph1: Try to be as accurate as possible.
trial3.paragraph2: Some words will be hard, and that&#39s okay. If you&#39re not sure, just give your best guess!

postPracticeTrial.header1: Great work, you are ready to begin the journey!
postPracticeTrial.header2: Great work, you are ready to begin the real activity!
postPracticeTrial.paragraph1: You will earn gold coins along the way.

practiceFeedbackTrial.paragraph1: You pressed the {{direction}} arrow which is for {{typeWord}} words!
practiceFeedbackTrial.paragraph2: is a {{typeWord}}  word. Press the {{direction}} arrow to continue.
